Detailed Description

A set of function to compute derivation.

This is a set of function that can compute the first and second derivatives for any discrete function

Function Documentation

◆ Frstder_adaptive_reggrid() [1/2]

Deriv_out Frstder_adaptive_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y)

Computes the first derivative of a list of values with adaptive precision.

The computation is adaptive in the sense that the precision order of the derivative is automatically adjusted depending on the region (lower edge, center, upper edge) in which the derivative is computed.

Parameters
yA vector containing the list of values.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vector y must have a size greater than or equal to 2. If the size is less than 2, the behavior is undefined.

◆ Frstder_adaptive_reggrid() [2/2]

Deriv_out Frstder_adaptive_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y,
const VectorXd &  x 
)

Computes the first derivative of a list of values with adaptive precision.

The computation is adaptive in the sense that the precision order of the derivative is automatically adjusted depending on the region (lower edge, center, upper edge) in which the derivative is computed.

Parameters
yA vector containing the list of values.
xA vector containing the corresponding x values for the points in y.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vectors y and x must have the same size and have a size greater than or equal to 2. If the size is less than 2 or the sizes of y and x are not equal, the behavior is undefined.

◆ Fstder_backward_1err_reggrid() [1/2]

Deriv_out Fstder_backward_1err_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y)

Computes the first order backward derivative with 1st order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 2 points: y at x-1 (y[0]) and y at x (y[1]).
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vector y must have a size of at least 2. If the size is less than 2, the program will exit with an error message.

◆ Fstder_backward_1err_reggrid() [2/2]

Deriv_out Fstder_backward_1err_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y,
const VectorXd &  x 
)

Computes the first order backward derivative with 1st order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 2 points: y at x-1 (y[0]) and y at x (y[1]).
xA vector containing the corresponding x values for the points in y.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vectors y and x must have a size of at least 2. If the size is less than 2, the program will exit with an error message.

◆ Fstder_centered_2err_reggrid() [1/2]

Deriv_out Fstder_centered_2err_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y)

Computes the first order centered derivative with 2nd order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 3 points: y at x-1 (y[0]), y at x (y[1]), and y at x+1 (y[2]).
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vector y must have a size of at least 3. If the size is less than 3, the program will exit with an error message.

◆ Fstder_centered_2err_reggrid() [2/2]

Deriv_out Fstder_centered_2err_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y,
const VectorXd &  x 
)

Computes the first order centered derivative with 2nd order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 3 points: the position y at x-1 (y[0]), y at x (y[1]), and y at x+1 (y[2]).
xA vector containing the corresponding x values for the points in y.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vectors y and x must have a size of at least 3. If the size is less than 3, the program will exit with an error message.

◆ Fstder_centered_4err_reggrid() [1/2]

Deriv_out Fstder_centered_4err_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y,
const VectorXd &  x 
)

Computes the first order centered derivative with 4th order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 5 points: the position y at x-2 (y[0]) to y at x+2 (y[4]).
xA vector containing the corresponding x values for the points in y.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vectors y and x must have a size of at least 5. If the size is less than 5, the program will exit with an error message.

◆ Fstder_centered_4err_reggrid() [2/2]

Deriv_out Fstder_centered_4err_reggrid ( const VectorXd  y)

Computes the first order centered derivative with 4th order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 5 points: the position y at x-2 (y[0]) to y at x+2 (y[4]).
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vector y must have a size of at least 5. If the size is less than 5, the program will exit with an error message.

Deriv_out Fstder_forward_1err_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y)

Computes the first order forward derivative with 1st order precision.

Parameters
yA vector containing 2 points: y at x (y[0]) and y at x+1 (y[1]).
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vector y must have a size of at least 2. If the size is less than 2, the program will exit with an error message.

◆ Scndder_adaptive_reggrid() [1/2]

Deriv_out Scndder_adaptive_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y)

Computes the second derivative of a list of values with adaptive precision.

The computation is adaptive in the sense that the precision order of the derivative is automatically adjusted depending on the region (lower edge, center, upper edge) in which the derivative is computed.

Parameters
yA vector containing the list of values.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vector y must have a size greater than or equal to 3. If the size is less than 3, the behavior is undefined.

◆ Scndder_adaptive_reggrid() [2/2]

Deriv_out Scndder_adaptive_reggrid ( const VectorXd &  y,
const VectorXd &  x 
)

Computes the second derivative of a list of values with adaptive precision.

The computation is adaptive in the sense that the precision order of the derivative is automatically adjusted depending on the region (lower edge, center, upper edge) in which the derivative is computed.

Parameters
yA vector containing the list of values.
xA vector containing the corresponding x values for the points in y.
Returns
Deriv_out A structure containing the computed derivative.
Note
The vectors y and x must have the same size and have a size greater than or equal to 3. If the size is less than 3 or the sizes of y and x are not equal, the behavior is undefined.
